comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:NEILL, REGINALD HENRY
Initials:R H
Nationality:United Kingdom
Rank:Lieutenant
Regiment/Service:Royal Irish Rifles
Unit Text:11th Bn.
Age:21
Date of Death:01/07/1916
Additional information:Son of Reginald and Geraldine Neill, of "Sheena", Craigavad, Co. Down.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:Pier and Face 15 A and 15 B.
Memorial:THIEPVAL MEMORIAL

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Should, I believe, read:  11th Battalion Royal Irish Rifles (South Antrim Volunteers), part of 108th Brigade, 36th Ulster Division, which on 1st July 1916 attacked the German 99th Reserve Battalion near Thiepval in the South Ancre Sector.

The evacuation of the wounded Captain Charles Craig, MP for South Antrim, to medical attention in a wheelbarrow by the Germans is recounted in 'The First Day on the Somme' by Martin Middlebrook.//
